Details.Textbox24:
Brown-Forman is a diversified producer of fine quality consumer products. It was founded in 1870 by George Garvin Brown in Louisville, KY, U.S. His original brand, Old Forester Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whisky, was America's first bottled bourbon and remains one of Brown-Forman's finest brands today. Geo. Garvin Brown IV, a descendant of the founder, is part of the 5th generation of Brown Family members engaged with the company and serves as the Presiding Chairman of the Board.
Brown-Forman employs 4,120 people worldwide with about 1,000 located in Louisville. Brown-Forman, one of the largest American-owned spirits and wine companies and among the top 10 largest global spirits companies, sells its brands in more than 135 countries and has offices in cities across the globe. In all, Brown-Forman has more than 25 brands in its portfolio of wines and spirits.
Details.Textbox73: Reporting Protocol: General Reporting Protocol 2.1 and associated updates and clarifications

Source Emissions | Diesel Mobile

Source Emissions | Fugitive emissions- stationary and mobile To calculate the fugitive emissions from refrigeration and air conditioning sources, the methodology of the Climate Leaders Greenhouse Gas Inventory Protocol Core Module Guidance Direct HFC and PFC emissions from use of refrigeration and air conditioning equipment is used. Emissions from Operation = C * ( x/100) * T, where C= charge capacity of the piece of equipment, x = annual leak rate in percent of capacity, T = time in years used during the reporting period
Source Emissions | Onsite pickup trucks- gasoline
Source Emissions | Propane (mobile)
Source Emissions | Tractor trailor- diesel

Source Emissions | Waste Wood Burning Using site specific heat content for the wood as the characteristics of the wood are quite different than the TCR guidance document provided wood. Emission factor determined using methodology provided by TCR - heat content*25.58kg MMBTU*44/12.
